metadata.title: Embedded Linux Education Kit
subject: linux
operating systems
embedded
yocto
metadata.creator: Mark Allen
metadata.description: To produce students who can develop an embedded Linux system on low-cost yet powerful Arm based platforms, including customer peripheral development for various applications using standard software tools. Syllabus, Introduction to Linux and Embedded Systems, Linux-based Embedded System Component Stack, Anatomy of a Linux-based System, Configuration and Build Process, Linux Kernel Modules, Communication Between Kernel and User Space, Application Demo: Building a Ranging Sensor Kernel Module, System Debugging and Profiling

metadata.title: Linux and Embedded Systems: An Introduction, Module 1
subject: linux
operating systems
embedded
yocto
metadata.creator: Mark Allen
metadata.description: To introduce the structure of the Embedded Linux Online Course, To introduce the concept of embedded systems, To provide a few illustrative examples of Linux-based embedded systems

metadata.title: Linux-based Embedded System Component Stack, Module 2
subject: Linux
Operating Systems
Embedded
Yocto
metadata.creator: Mark Allen
metadata.description: To illustrate the main components of a Linux-based embedded system, To analyze the bootstrap process

metadata.title: Introduction to the Board and Workspace Setup, Module 2, Lab 1
subject: Linux
Operating Systems
Embedded
Yocto
metadata.creator: Mark Allen
metadata.description: Introduce the Raspberry Pi 3 board and to provide instructions about how to set up the workspace used for the following labs.

metadata.title: Linux-based Embedded System Component Stack, Module 2, Quiz 1
subject: Linux
Operating Systems
Embedded
Yocto
metadata.creator: Mark Allen
metadata.description: Quiz questions based on a Linux-based embedded system component stack.

metadata.title: Anatomy of a Linux-based System, Module 3
subject: Linux
Operating Systems
Embedded
Yocto
metadata.creator: Mark Allen
metadata.description: The aim of this lecture is to: Provide a more detailed overview of the Linux architecture. Illustrate the device tree details. Introduce the U-Boot bootloader.

metadata.title: Anatomy of a Linux-based System, Module 3, Quiz 2
subject: Linux
Operating Systems
Embedded
Yocto
metadata.creator: Mark Allen
metadata.description: Quiz questions based on the anatomy of a Linux-based system.

metadata.title: Configuration & Build Process of an Embedded Linux System, Module 4
subject: Linux
Operating Systems
Embedded
Yocto
metadata.creator: Mark Allen
metadata.description: The aim of this lecture is to: Illustrate the configuration and build process of an embedded Linux system. Illustrate the concept of build systems.

metadata.title: Configuration & Build Process of an Embedded Linux System, Module 4, Quiz 3
subject: Linux
Operating Systems
Embedded
Yocto
metadata.creator: Mark Allen
metadata.description: Quiz questions based on the configuration and build process of an embedded Linux system.

metadata.title: Introduction to Linux Kernel Modules, Module 5
subject: Linux
Operating Systems
Embedded
Yocto
metadata.creator: Mark Allen
metadata.description: The aim of this lecture is to: Discuss the central processing unit (CPU) and input/output (I/O) interfaces, the virtual filesystem (VFS) abstraction and introduce Linux kernel modules

metadata.title: Introduction to Kernel Modules under Yocto, Module 5, Lab 2
subject: Linux
Operating Systems
Embedded
Yocto
metadata.creator: Mark Allen
metadata.description: To build a simple loadable kernel module using the Yocto build environment.

subject: Linux

Embedded
Yocto

subject: Linux
Operating Systems
Embedded
Yocto
metadata.creator: Mark Allen
metadata.description: Quiz questions based on kernel modules with Yocto.

metadata.title: Communication Between Kernel and User Space, Module 6
subject: Linux
Operating Systems
Embedded
Yocto
metadata.creator: Mark Allen
metadata.description: The aim of this lecture is to: Delve into more details about Linux kernel modules. Illustrate the communication mechanism between kernel and user memory spaces

metadata.title: Handling General Purpose I/O Using Linux Kernel Modules, Module 6, Lab 3
subject: Linux
Operating Systems
Embedded
Yocto
metadata.creator: Mark Allen
metadata.description: Build a loadable kernel module using the Yocto build environment - which provides access to one general purpose I/O (GPIO) as output and one GPIO as input, handled in interrupt mode.

subject: Linux
Operating Systems
Embedded
Yocto

metadata.title: Application Demo: Building a Ranging Sensor Kernel Module, Module 7
subject: Linux
Operating Systems
Embedded
Yocto
metadata.creator: Mark Allen
metadata.description: The aim of this lecture is to: Discuss user-level communication with kernel modules. Present an example to support a hardware device connected to a board

subject: Linux
Operating Systems
Embedded
Yocto
metadata.creator: Mark Allen
metadata.description: Build a loadable kernel module using the Yocto build environment that provides access to the HC-SR04 ranging sensor.

metadata.title: Introduction to code development and debugging using Yocto, Module 8, Lab 5
subject: Linux
Operating Systems
Embedded
Yocto
metadata.creator: Mark Allen
metadata.description: To set up the development environment using Yocto to write and cross-compile applications for the embedded Linux running on the Raspberry Pi 3 and to perform remote debugging operations.

subject: Linux
Operating Systems
Embedded
Yocto
metadata.creator: Mark Allen
metadata.description: To allow you to use the Arm Streamline tool to profile the execution of code running on the Raspberry Pi 3.
